org.xlattice.corexml.expr

Class CharTypes

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.corexml.expr.CharTypes

  • public class CharTypes
extends java.lang.Object
    Except where otherwise noted, cited rules are in XPath 1.0 standard. Rule cites look like "[NN]", where NN represents a number. Quotation marks around characters are dropped when quoting rules.

    This implementation is not fully consistent with XPath 1.0, which appears not to make sense in certain respects.

    Author:
    Jim Dixon

      • isNameChar

        public static boolean isNameChar(char c)
        Recognizer for characters that may be part of names. XXX The current implementation is NOT consistent with the XML Names spec, which permits '.' and many other characters (letters, CombiningChar, and Extender).

      • startsName

        public static boolean startsName(char c)
        Recognizer for characters that may start names.
